quote: Noether's Theorem mathematically proves that For any symmetry in physical laws, there exists a corresponding conservation law in the system.
Einstien's Theory Of General Relativity says that gravity is not a force, all objects follow their natural path through space-time, and force that changes that path is what we experience as Gravity.
Einstien's Theory Of General Relativity says the force we feel is not the Earth's gravity that is pulling, but the force from the floor stopping us from falling.
The Principle of Least action shows that a particle travelling between two points will always take the path which will correspond to smallest sum of energy throughout the path.
When considered with Quantum Mechanics, Priciple of Least action can imply that a particle actually 'smells' path of least action, analogous to diffraction.
Theory of Quantum Electrodynamics has been tested to the accuracy of measuring diameter of Earth with error of a fifth of human hair.
Gravity is the weakest force, yet it holds galaxies together : A small magnet can keep a pin stuck to it, even when whole Earth is pulling down on the pin.
